page.title: 05HOUSE TYPES
page.content: The third type, private dwellings newly built either to set design on small private estates or individually designed on small plots of land located away from commercial and industrial activity. Typical examples of this type of property are as follows:-Bungalows, dorma type bungalows with bedrooms built into the roof, mock period dwellings i.e. Georgian, Tudor and "Futuristic Designs"i.e. glass, steel constructions.Another catagory is now becoming widespread, sheltered housing. This is a system whereby elderly people who wish, are able to live in controlled situation whereby they have their own private home within a supervised environment where assistance is quickly available if needed. In this area these sheltered accomodations are council run.
